Bay Area freeway shootings nearly quadrupled in 4 years. Almost half were in one county

Freeway shootings, concentrated in the East Bay, have risen dramatically in recent years. Among the lives claimed by these split-second attacks were a toddler strapped in his car seat, teenagers packed onto a party bus and Amani Morris, a mother on her way to a job orientation. Their stories reflect the human toll of a trend that presents galling challenges for law enforcement.
